summary: This bill, the Federal Insurance Office Elimination Act, aims to eliminate the Federal Insurance Office (FIO) of the Department of the Treasury. It removes the FIO, including the Director position, and makes related amendments to the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (specifically sections 111, 112, 165, and 203) and the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief, and Consumer Protection Act to reflect the FIO's elimination. The bill clarifies that any authority of the Secretary of the Treasury relating to insurance remains unchanged.
